text: ahh that is an instagram profile for your team??
What are you hoping to study at uni? Royal Holloway is very good

You can definitely do practical stuff at university too (if they do an industrial placement / work exp) as part of the course. Some degree apprenticeships actually have employers pay for your uni AND you have a job earning money the whole time too.
You should check out IBM - they do some of the best apprenticeships in the tech space

attachments.text: Explore IBM career opportunities today. The world is changing - be part of the transformation and find the right fit for your skills, passions and career goals.
attachments.fallback: Explore IBM career opportunities today. The world is changing - be part of the transformation and find the right fit for your skills, passions and career goals.

text: So my CV is above^ ... of course I have a lot more work experience than you, but pay attention to the section on the "Education" and "Interests & Achievements" sections. Also the section on "Continuing professional education" you might like to re-shape to include any awards or training courses you have been on.

I can imagine your first draft CV will not be very long. You should aim to not have it go over 1 page at this stage in your career. Do you want to fill in the sections with your experience as a first draft? Then I can give you feedback and criticism to help you improve :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:
For work experience: I think you should brainstorm companies that are local to where you live that might have a tech team / department. Can you think of any?
I think you have quite a few tech companies near Hayes (Rackspace, Rocket Software etc.)
It could also be worth asking your school IT team if you can get some experience volunteering with them and get insights to cyber security

There isn't necessarily a set process for finding and securing work experience (it's not like a UCAS application to uni), so you have to put yourself out there! You could:
> Call or email local employers who you think might have an IT team and ask to get involved for a week or two (also check out their websites in case they happen to list work experience opps there)
> Do you have any family and friends who are in the tech space that you can ask?
> In the future you could ask us here at Prospela (at the moment our team don't yet have an office, but when we grow we would definitely love to have you in for work experience! As I'm sure many other companies would, just ask!)
> You could search on volunteering websites for any tech companies or teams you could get involved in (this would would unpaid of course, but could be a great way to get your foot in the door). There are many websites out there, but some I've heard of are: <https://do-it.org/>, <https://reachvolunteering.org.uk/i-want-volunteer> and <https://volunteerteam.london.gov.uk>
